title: The Great Gatsby
description: A story about the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his passion for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan during the Jazz Age.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic romantic novel about Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates society, love, and misunderstandings with the proud Mr. Darcy.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, exploring themes of surveillance and truth.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about racism and injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: Jane Eyre
description: An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her mysterious employer, Mr. Rochester, while uncovering secrets at Thornfield Hall.

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A dark tale of passion and revenge between Catherine and Heathcliff, set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Little Women
description: The story of the March sisters as they grow up during the Civil War, dealing with love, loss, and ambition.

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic society driven by technology, genetic engineering, and consumerism is questioned by an outsider.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: Holden Caulfield recounts his days in New York City after being expelled from prep school, exploring themes of alienation.

title: Frankenstein
description: A scientist creates a living being, only to face the consequences of playing God in this gothic horror classic.
